ygData.subject: RE: Dex vrs Agility
ygData.msgSnippet: From what I observed before 96 is a base AC breakpoint for agility, that is a naked AC is better at 96 than at 95.  101 is a AC multiplier breakpoint, that is
ygData.messageBody:
From what I observed before 96 is a base AC breakpoint for agility, that is
a naked AC is better at 96 than at 95. 101 is a AC multiplier breakpoint,
that is the amount a piece of ac10 armor improves your ac goes up when you
go from 100 to 101. I didn't have enough resources to definitively check
this before, but now that I do I will make an effort to examine it
thoroughly this weekend.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Woland Vildhufvud [mailto:wolandv@...]
Sent: Friday, September 10, 1999 12:57 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Dex vrs Agility


From: "Woland Vildhufvud" <wolandv@...>

I was gonna say, NO agi does not raise AC, but made a final test just to be
sure. =)
With a base AGI of 90, no AGI items and nothing in ear and finger slots I
equipped a total of four +2 AGI (no other stats or AC) rings and earrings.
As I added the third item and my AGI went to 96 my AC increased from 423 to
425. Not much but increased it did, and since others have suggested that
there is a difference between 100 and 101 AGI one might draw the conclusion
that AC increases in 5 AGI steps...

I sure hope AGI also make them hit you less often...a 2 AC increase is not
gonna save my life to often lol

Woland - lvl 21 confused bard who forgot to update his jewelry and who
wonders why his AC seem to drop the more he lvls and the more plats he spend

=)


>From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
>There are agility bonuses that differ when you hit certain points. I had a
>100 agility and an AC of around 200 or so when I got my first agility
>boosting item. Going from 100 to 102 with no attached AC bumped my AC up
>by
>9 points. Not sure if there are bonuses at points past 101, but I would
>imagine they get spread out at that point. I checked with a new character
>and 101 is definitely better than 100 and 110 is no different from 101.
>Could not add enough points to reach 111 so could not check that, will try
>with a halfling rogue to see if bonuses really do continue past 101, and
>will report back on Monday.
>
> Kitasi the agile?
>
